Yamamoto yutaka, who was the director of Kannagi, recently said this on his official line blog.
"Now Japan will not need an idol."
Wait, hold on second. What does he mean by that? No, I wonder if there was a lot of idol animation in the past as it is now. There are love live, sunshine, Aimas, Cindemas, WUG, and 22/7, which is Yasushi Akimoto's new plan just as soon as we think about it. So many idol animations are coming out, what are you talking about?
Yamakan, no matter how you think, the public needs an idol. You may have to ask.
But there is context to theword. The public may need an idol that mediates "animation", but it does not seem to require idol with real blood and flesh. It is true that the idol that has been accepted by the public literally as an "idol" can go up to the 80s if it goes back to history, but it is now disappearing after the prescription. SMAP has breaking-up, and who are concentrating on entertainment activities such as AKB48, NMB48 and other female idols.

Among them, there are some members who graduate from Idol and enter freshmen in Yoshimoto Kogyo. The public now treats the idol as a common gossip, and only accepts it as an object of entertainment on TV. As Yamakan said, the idol has already done its prescription.


The same thing happens in «Kannagi». The giant new wood guarding the Kannagi Village is cut down by the compartmentalization, and the Kannagi Shrine (where the anime pilgrimage is the highest level of difficulty) will also disappear. Mikuriya Jin, who was doing sculpture for the exhibition with that part of wood, have a surprise experience, and suddenly a woman with blue hair suddenly appears from the carved wood and introduces herself as "God".


What the f**k.


Mikuriya-kun is embarrassed to hear the ridiculous sound, but looking at the situation and think, she was really holy God. It would be glad that it ends, but in the village, the idol character "Zange(Confession) chan" was doing a part-time job with 100 yen for the confession of a person who were in trouble. Wander around in a machi(village in japan) I would be surprised if I met someone like this on the street. It turns out that the confessor was a sister of Nagi, who was fall apart from one wood. And animation falls into the shadows of despair, hope and humor. I can tell that almost all the fairy tale dancing, open the door and closing, sadness and ordering scenes in episode 10, is a magnum opus of this animation.


However, Kannagi suddenly starts to develop rapidly from episode 11. Is Nagi really a god? Jin talks with his teacher, Suzushiro, who teaches religion, and begins to question. Nagi does not know why she should handle the denial, and what original name is. She does not know anything about it. but anyway, the relationship between them suddenly deteriorates. Nagi did runaway and stays at grandmother's house for a while (for details, it can be spoiled). So the story goes, and after the episode 12, the unexpected ending waits in the last episode. I do not know if it's anyone else, but I really didn't know that the animation would end like this. It was honestly shocking and surprising.


Come back to talk about idol again, Kannagi is a god who had been guarding the village for a long time. God = idol disappears when people are forgotten. However, by chance, she returns to her village and gains faith from students, she becomes an idol at school. The light comes from the Onosa(a cheap magic wand). Although it is often used as a gag material, the idea that many people make the "god" of the village possible, is quite same as the idea that many people's whole love can make idols possible. Obviously it existed long time ago. Maybe even a little bit right now. But ultimately it is destined to disappear.


If the language changes, then the definition of the language also changes. The meaning of idol is arbitrarily determined, and there is no reason to limit it to a single meaning. However, even if we need 'idol', if it does not have any contact with the reality (Yamakan has obviously done such attempt), the future suddenly has a different appearance from what we expected. If you can say one thing, the future is "World has lost its God." This is why God did not exist in Japan. The future anthropologist may say like that. This is because we don't need God anymore, not because the god was gone. God = Nature is still here.


Maybe we can say, Kannagi was an animation that predicted modern Japanese society? I think that if you are looking at it quietly, you will be agree. It may be meaningful to see this animation again right now. I realized that, famous movie Spirited Away's theme song "Itsumo Nando demo(in English Always, Numerous Times)", I recall the lyrics of this beautiful song.

A Story about a guy who made a statue. he was about to brought it to his school, but suddenly the statue disappeared. the statued was outside of his house and connected to the ground (dirt) few seconds later the statue broke into peices and, guess what ? a young girl appeared from inside of the statue.

Kannagi is a great mix of different genres that often have difficulty working together, though whether they actually mix well may be a matter of opinion. The supernatural topics are very matter of fact, in that it's not overblown or annoying, but it is a story of a spiritual and supernatural nature in a casual and lighthearted way. It is an odd mix of Serious and Comedy, but personally I think that's the best part. At different points it had me screeching and dying from laughing so hard, and it had me bawling in other spots. The best part is that it's actually pretty spreadout, they don't try to pack feels and laughs together too much, the feelings generally have different arcs and different episodes. As a Comedy it's fantastic in places, as a drama it's not very consistent but it sure got hearty tears from me, but I think that as a show... It's well rounded and fantastic. Everything flows and works well together. Not to mention the *God-tier* animation quality. Very good.

Well i didn't really enjoy this anime too much since I am not into art and im quite religious, the idea of anyone deeming themselves god is naturally against my chain of thought however in my honest opinion the anime didn't satisfy me in any way in the end with nothing profound happening 
It also drifted away from their initial plot to destroy the impurities too much.
However the character Nagi was well structured most girls of that age are as immature as that and lock themselves in cupboards when things aren't going their way i enjoyed that episode somewhat more than any of the others

It is unusual for a 13 episode shounen anime. I don't know if the manga is more clear than the anime, it might answer those questions. 
And if they will produce another season, that would make things right.....*__*

It was a really fun watch. Rather short being able to complete it in just a few hours. I was rather disappointed in the ending, but in harem-like animes its easy to feel that way.
I enjoyed well-defined relationships among characters because it is so well defined--much more then any of the characters individually. 
The episodes in the middle seem a lot more slice-of-life then I expected, but they made it work.

Kannagi is quite the show for sure. It may be viewed at first glance as another comedic high school harem anime, but in truth it really is a bit more than that. This show definitely has its fair share of cliché episodes with tons of memorable and humorous moments, as well as also driving home an acceptable amount of thought towards gods, self awareness, discovering oneself, etc.
Before I cover the my big complaints to the show, I'll start off with the small stuff
Art (10) - It's a beautiful show. Especially for what... Being released in the 2000's? It surprised me actually. Everyone looks very fluffyand dare I say, lush. Smooth smooth smooth Animation as well!


Sound (7) - I've never been too picky on this section in particular. Probably since I'm an English speaker and since I'm not from Japan, I don't seem to pick up on the quality of voice acting as much. I will say I have heard Very well done voice acting in anime before, but most are just... Normal sounding. And this is what this show has in particular. Just normal. But as far as the music goes... Love the OP, love the ED, and Soundtrack within the episodes is, y'know , a regualr Soundtrack. Overall it's okay.


Enjoyment (7) - Kannagi is a great show! I would definitely recommend it to any friend of mine. It's quite light hearted and doesn't rely heavily on jokes about perversion and indecency, unlike most shows unfortunately. It has its fair share of those of course, and people seem to be even categorizing the anime as a harem as well, but the "perversion" is not so overpowering that it takes over the show and ruins it. It's done moderately, which is a very nice touch and shows its maturity compared to other shows. Other than that stupid perversion shit or whatever, the show contains many great memorable moments and episodes! Lemme tell ya, it's a funny show! It really is! It stands out a little more for sure.


Story (6) - alright, so this is probably where people may disagree with me. First off let me say, the IDEA for the story is great, but how it was executed could have had been done better. Not by much, it was done pretty well, but there were definitely many sections in the anime that were either unnecessary, boring, or just had little to no action on forwarding the character development. The best example of this was the karaoke bar episode. I won't spoil what happens blah blah blah, but I have one big complaint. The show uses half the time in this episode to either fill in slapstick comedy, funny jokes and remarks that the Characters quote to eachother, or just plain silliness. Sure you could say this continues the character development... But I beg to differ. I say this because I believe the show could do without the  cliché episodes like the karaoke bar. Sure the episode covers what would happen when all the characters are out in the situation of hanging out in the karaoke bar, including the social tensions, internal and external feelings and all, but the show develops the Characters in the more unproductive way like most bottom bin niche 12 episode animes. The way the show executes the scenario and reactions of characters during the karaoke bar episode DO add character development, but in a very shallow way. The whole purpose of that episode (and for just about any episode to any show) was to build up a way to prove a point at the end which further adds to the development of the storyline. But in this particular episode, there is no buildup. It just aimlessly wanders around, making jokes and slapstick comedy to fill in the gap. What I'm trying to say, is that SOME episodes could be used in a more resourceful manner that is not just filler. This does not only happen in the karaoke bar episode either. There are at least 2 or 3 that do this as well.

BUT OTHER THAN THAT BIG COMPLAINT, the show is great! Most of the episodes are very enjoyable and do a fine job at keeping my attention, and progressing the story, Characters, and Themes. I wouldn't say it is the deepest show, but it allows for ones mind to think a bit and realize some things they may not have though of before. Overall, great story, despite the large complaint.


Characters (7) - The Characters are lovable ,for sure! Like I said above though, some of the episodes dont do the best job of developing the Characters, and some of the episodes barely address one of the main characters, Nagi as much as you would think they should. Then again, the same goes for every character in the show, but of course, it's only 13 episodes so you can't expect TOO much. Generally speaking, they did a good job. there wasnt really one character I disliked.


Overall (7) In a nutshell, Kannagi is an enjoyable anime to the average viewer and is a perfect show to be watched casually, yet the show spends too much time not progressing the story or characters in each episode, which ends up making each minute not as captivating as the last in some cases. Kannagi by all means is not a bad anime. It's actually one of the better short series shoes you can watch, but in my personal opinion, it still contains that slight disconnect from the show being a classic with each episode being amazing and memorable to the show just throwing certain cliché scenarios to fill the void in the storyline. Good show, but like most shows in general, it has room for improvement.

Sometimes, the best series hide itself for people to see its true beauty. This is one of those series. It had its ups and downs, it wasn't perfect, but it was able to present its story naturally.
If you judge this series from its art style, then you're missing out on so much. The plot of this series doesn't compare to it. Sure, the animation is too simple and not as exaggerated as I hoped, but the execution of the scenes was more important to me than the display of tantalizing effects. I can still remember the theme track used. It was simple, but it capturedthe atmosphere of the setting: nice and quiet. \n\n
Yes, it might be boring at first glance. But give it a chance and you'll enjoy it just as I did. I highly recommend this for those looking for underrated series. For sure, You'll love the mystical world of Kannagi!

The concept of a parody Anime is hardly anything new. It's been going on for quite some time now with notable examples being Excel Saga and Sayonara Zetsubou Sensei. Kannagi fits in a group with them quite nicely, but this show is far more subtle about its business.
It rides the line between parody and straight almost effortlessly. The show has a plot and the purpose of the show isn't to mock other Anime or the archetypes, cliches and tropes; yet by some great directing and writing it manages to do all of that effortlessly while lightly telling its story. The plot isn't particularly heavy butonce it's the focus of the show it doesn't dilute anything like you see in a lot of comedy shows. Everything here works nicely as a cohesive package and satisfies from beginning to end.


It's sad to see how quickly people forgot this show considering it was such a big hit in the Fall of 08', but most Anime fans, myself included on occasion, have a short attention span. I also wonder if it had to do with the waning health of the Mangaka behind this series or even the massive 2ch outrage at her for writing one of the characters had lost her virginity in the past. However I digress because that will lead into a long essay about why 2ch is bad for Anime and full of idiots.


Go watch this show, you'll love it.

Kannagi was laugh out loud funny a couple of times in each episode, with the exception of the last few episodes which were more serious.
The characters in this series were excellent.  It was fun to watch.
I'm looking forward to another season.
